intro: Hedlundia subpinnata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hedlundia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are narrow and linear, with a distinctive arrangement that gives it its species name "subpinnata." Hedlundia subpinnata produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators.
